author: Brookie Smallz

text:
I really enjoyed this game and its music~ Unfortunately I played it so intermittently that I could barely piece together the story.
I loved how they broke the fourth wall a little, it actually made me feel more connected to the characters.
The last boss was pretty annoying, but not too bad if you had enough potions.

Did you guys know there's apparently going to be an (indirect) sequel to this game? I'd really love to see it.
author: Sayeth Di Puppeth

text: I don't think this would actually be categorized as minimalist, but that's just a formality. Interesting composition.

author: Sassiest Steve

text:
This was a pretty unique game by Grasshopper with charming graphics and music (Takada composed for the No More Heroes series). I wasn't a big fan of the battle system though and the difficulty felt uneven, I'm not sure if that was just me though.

A minimalist but relaxing theme, a great way to end the game.
author: SupraDarky
